original: bod skad du /

original: legs par grub par byed pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bsdus pa /
analyzed: legs par grub par byed pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bsdus pa /
translated: The Collection of the Means of Achievement Called “The One Who Brings About Good Success”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽de nas sgrub pa pos 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan ba bsgrub pa dang / dngos grub bla na med pa 'dod pa rnams la legs par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo // de nas sgrub pa pos 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan ba bsgrub pa dang / dngos grub bla na med pa 'dod pa rnams la legs par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba /
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: rigs gsum spyi'i sgrub pa'i cho ga rab tu gsal bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs gsum spyi'i sgrub pa'i cho ga rab tu gsal bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, for those who wish to achieve the benefit of all beings and the unsurpassed powers, I will explain the ritual of the general practice of the three families called “The One Who Brings About Good Success,”🔽which is very clear.

original: de la re zhig dang po slob dpon gyi yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i slob dpon gyis sgrub pa po bdag nyid mngon par dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba /
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po slob dpon gyi yon tan dang rjes su mthun pa'i slob dpon gyis sgrub pa po bdag nyid mngon par dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba /
translated: There, first of all, the master, who is in accord with the qualities of the master, should confer the consecration and permission upon the practitioner himself.

original: rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgrub pa po'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid legs par tshogs pa /
analyzed: rgyud las gsungs pa'i sgrub pa po'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid legs par tshogs pa /
translated: He should be endowed with the characteristics of a mantra practitioner as taught in the tantras, and should be well-endowed with the characteristics of the mantra.

original: dngos grub las kyi bye brag la mkhas pa mthun pa'i dus kyi dbye ba shes pa /
analyzed: dngos grub las kyi bye brag la mkhas pa mthun pa'i dus kyi dbye ba shes pa /
translated: He is skilled in the various kinds of ritual actions that bring about spiritual attainments, and he knows the divisions of the auspicious times.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i cho ga rig pa /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga'i cho ga rig pa /
translated: He is knowledgeable in the rites of the five offerings.🔽He is endowed with a mantra attendant who is suitable for his own characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i sngags g-yog dang ldan pas sgrub pa'i yan lag gis yo byad thams cad bsdu bar bya'o //🔽de nas gsang sngags yongs su bzung ba'i cho gas gang la mngon par dad pa'i gsang @121a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i sngags g-yog dang ldan pas sgrub pa'i yan lag gis yo byad thams cad bsdu bar bya'o // de nas gsang sngags yongs su bzung ba'i cho gas gang la mngon par dad pa'i gsang @121a * //
translated: He should gather all the articles with the branch of practice.

original: sngags mnos te /
analyzed: sngags mnos te /
translated: Then, by the rite of taking up the mantra, he should take up the mantra in which he has faith.

original: gsang sngags dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul ji skad bstan pa dngos grub dang 'tsham pa'i gnas ji skad gsungs pa dag tu ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gnas bya ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags dang rjes su mthun pa'i yul ji skad bstan pa dngos grub dang 'tsham pa'i gnas ji skad gsungs pa dag tu ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gnas bya ste /
translated: In a place that is suitable for the mantra, in a place that is suitable for spiritual attainments as taught, he should make a dwelling that has the characteristics as taught.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: He should begin the preliminary approximation.

original: de la nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du 'di ltar bya ste //
analyzed: de la nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du 'di ltar bya ste //
translated: In that regard, he should do this three times a day, every day.

original: nang par mal nas langs te rigs gsum gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang par mal nas langs te rigs gsum gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: In the morning, having gotten up from bed, he should bind the pledge seal of the three families.

original: de la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya ni thal mo bkan pa las mdzub mo gnyis cung zad tsam bkug ste mgo la bzhag pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de la dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya ni thal mo bkan pa las mdzub mo gnyis cung zad tsam bkug ste mgo la bzhag pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The pledge seal of the three pledges is to place one’s cupped palms, with the index fingers slightly bent, on one’s head. This is the pledge seal of the tathāgata family.

original: gsang sngags la /
analyzed: gsang sngags la /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom ta th'a ga totbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /🔽thal mo sbyar ba padma kha phye ba'i tshul du bya ste /
analyzed: aom ta th'a ga totbha b'a ya sv'a h'a / thal mo sbyar ba padma kha phye ba'i tshul du bya ste /
translated: oṃ tathāgatoṣṇīṣāya svāhā.🔽The lotus pledge seal is to place one’s cupped palms in the manner of an opened lotus at one’s heart.

original: snying gar bzhag pa 'di ni padma'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: snying gar bzhag pa 'di ni padma'i rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: This is the pledge seal of the lotus family.

original: gsang sngags la /
analyzed: gsang sngags la /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom padmo tbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom padmo tbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ padmoṣṇīṣāya svāhā.

original: lag pa thal mo bzlog ste sbyar la mthe bong gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis sbyar nas lte ba'i thad kar bzhag ste 'di ni rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa thal mo bzlog ste sbyar la mthe bong gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis sbyar nas lte ba'i thad kar bzhag ste 'di ni rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The vajra pledge seal is to place one’s cupped palms, with the thumbs and little fingers joined, at one’s navel. This is the pledge seal of the vajra family.

original: gsang sngags la /
analyzed: gsang sngags la /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom badzro tbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzro tbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajroṣṇīṣāya svāhā.

original: de nas phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du dmigs la gsang sngags 'dis phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon sum du dmigs la gsang sngags 'dis phyag bya'o //
translated: Then, all the Tathagatas dwelling in the ten directions, infinite and boundless, are visualized as present, and one should pay homage with this mantra:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badzra pra na mya na sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra p'a da banda n'am ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'a ka tsitta badzra pra na mya na sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra p'a da banda n'am ka ro mi /
translated: Om, homage to the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas, homage to the vajra feet of all Tathagatas.

original: de nas de dag la bdag la dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag la bdag la dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should offer oneself to them:

original: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid byang chub snying po la mchis kyi bar du dus thams cad du yong ye 'bul na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid byang chub snying po la mchis kyi bar du dus thams cad du yong ye 'bul na /
translated: To all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas dwelling in the ten directions, infinite and boundless, I offer myself at all times until the essence of enlightenment is attained.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bdag bzhes su gsol /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bdag bzhes su gsol /
translated: May the Buddhas and great Bodhisattvas accept me.

original: bdag la dngos grub bla na med pa stsal du gsol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la dngos grub bla na med pa stsal du gsol zhes bya'o //
translated: May they grant me the highest spiritual power.

original: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should generate the mind of enlightenment:

original: sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs mchog la /🔽byang chub bar du bdag skyabs mchi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang tshogs mchog la / byang chub bar du bdag skyabs mchi //
translated: to the Buddha, Dharma, and the supreme Sangha.

original: bdag dang gzhan don sgrub slad du //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan don sgrub slad du //
translated: In order to accomplish the welfare of self and other,

original: bdag gis byang chub sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub sems bskyed do //
translated: I generate the awakening mind.🔽May the buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa yi //🔽sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' gson //🔽bdag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub phyir //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag na bzhugs pa yi // sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' gson // bdag gis rdzogs pa'i byang chub phyir //
translated: who dwell in the ten directions listen:🔽For the sake of perfect awakening,

original: de nas byang chub sems bskyed do //🔽de nas khro bo mnol ba med pa'am /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems bskyed do // de nas khro bo mnol ba med pa'am /
translated: I generate the awakening mind.🔽Then, either with the wrathful Amṛtakuṇḍali,

original: bdud rtsi thab @121b sbyor ram /
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab @121b sbyor ram /
translated: or with the Amṛtaḍāka,

original: yang na rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i chogs bdag nyid bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i chogs bdag nyid bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: or else with the rite taught in another tantra, you should perform self-protection.

original: de la mnol ba med pa'i sngags ni /🔽aom badzra kro dha ma h'a ba la ha na da ha pa tsa /
analyzed: de la mnol ba med pa'i sngags ni / aom badzra kro dha ma h'a ba la ha na da ha pa tsa /
translated: The mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali is:🔽Oṃ vajra-krodha mahābala hana daha pacha

original: bi dhva nsa ya au tsushma kro dha h'um phat /
analyzed: bi dhva nsa ya au tsushma kro dha h'um phat /
translated: vidhvaṃsana uṣṇīṣa-krodha hūṃ phaṭ.

original: lag pa gnyis sor mo phan tshun bsnol te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sor mo phan tshun bsnol te /
translated: Cross the fingers of the two hands.

original: khu tshur bcangs la mthe'u chung gnyis gshibs te bsgreng mdzub mo rtse mo sbyar ba'i glor mthe bong gnyis btsugs pa ni khro bo mnol ba med pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: khu tshur bcangs la mthe'u chung gnyis gshibs te bsgreng mdzub mo rtse mo sbyar ba'i glor mthe bong gnyis btsugs pa ni khro bo mnol ba med pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of angry Amogha is to make a fist, extend the two little fingers together, and insert the tips of the index fingers in between them, with the two thumbs placed on top.

original: bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sngags dang phyag rgya ni 'og nas bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sngags dang phyag rgya ni 'og nas bshad par bya ste //
translated: The mantra and mudra of Amrtakundali will be explained below.

original: rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa nyid las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: You should understand them from the tantras themselves.

original: de nas snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po'i ngo bo aa zhes bya ba dang / mgo bo la mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo ha zhes bya ba 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po'i ngo bo aa zhes bya ba dang / mgo bo la mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo ha zhes bya ba 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, on the moon mandala at the heart, imagine an A, the essence of Vairochana, and on the head, a HA, the essence of Acala, blazing with a garland of flames.

original: de nas sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddhonyham zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis dag par mos par byas la /
analyzed: de nas sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddhonyham zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis dag par mos par byas la /
translated: Then, with “Svabhava-sudha sarva dharma, svabhava-sudho’ham,” imagine that they are purified by nature.

original: de nas phyir byung ste so shing bca' ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyir byung ste so shing bca' ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: Then, having come out, you should chew the tooth stick and so forth.

original: lha'i khang pa la sogs pa bstar bar byas nas khrus byed du song shig / gzhan yang phyi rol gyi sar bshang gci byed pa'i dus dang / zan za ba'i tshe'ang khro bo mnol ba med pas bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i khang pa la sogs pa bstar bar byas nas khrus byed du song shig / gzhan yang phyi rol gyi sar bshang gci byed pa'i dus dang / zan za ba'i tshe'ang khro bo mnol ba med pas bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, when one is going to defecate and urinate outside, and also when one is eating, one should protect oneself with the wrathful Acala.

original: de nas skye bo 'du ba dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i 'jug ngogs su song ste /
analyzed: de nas skye bo 'du ba dang 'jigs pa la sogs pa spangs pa'i 'jug ngogs su song ste /
translated: Then, having gone to a ford free from crowds of people and fear, etc.,

original: gnas gtsang ma nas sa blangs la cha gsum du bgos te /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma nas sa blangs la cha gsum du bgos te /
translated: one should take earth from a clean place and divide it into three parts.

original: gnas gtsang mar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang mar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place it in a clean place.

original: sa blang ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: sa blang ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for taking the earth is:

original: aom ni kha na wa su dhe sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ni kha na wa su dhe sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ ni khaṇavasa sudhe svāhā.

original: lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo phyi rol du bsnol te bkug nas mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi sor mo phyi rol du bsnol te bkug nas mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng /
translated: Having crossed the fingers of both hands outward and bent them, one should extend the two index fingers side by side.

original: mthe bong gnyis de'i drung du gzhag go //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis de'i drung du gzhag go //
translated: One should place the two thumbs near them.

original: 'di'i gsang sngags dang bcas pas sa la gtug cing blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gsang sngags dang bcas pas sa la gtug cing blang bar bya'o //
translated: Together with this mantra, one should touch the earth and take it.

original: dang por dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la de nas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang por dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la de nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: First, one should form the pledge seal and then take it.

original: rigs gsum gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni bstan zin to //
translated: The pledges of the three families have already been explained.

original: de nas bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis bdag nyid bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyis bdag nyid bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should protect oneself with the nectar-holding-vajra.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni mthe bo'i ngos kyis mthe chung gi sen mo mnan la sor mo lhag ma rnams rdo rje'i mtshan nyid du bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni mthe bo'i ngos kyis mthe chung gi sen mo mnan la sor mo lhag ma rnams rdo rje'i mtshan nyid du bya ste /
translated: The seal is: with the back of the thumb press down on the nail of the little finger, and make the remaining fingers in the character of a vajra.

original: bsnol nas dpung bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: bsnol nas dpung bar bzhag ste /
translated: Cross them and place them on the upper arm.🔽With the upper teeth press down on the lower lip, and look with the gaze of wrath.

original: ya sos ma mchu mnan pa khro bo'i lta bas blta zhing gsang sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ya sos ma mchu mnan pa khro bo'i lta bas blta zhing gsang sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya.

original: na ma shtsanda badzra p'a na ye /
analyzed: na ma shtsanda badzra p'a na ye /
translated: Namo ścaṇḍavajrapāṇaye.

original: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: ma h'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Mahāyakṣasenāpataye.

original: na mo badzra kro dh'a ya /
analyzed: na mo badzra kro dh'a ya /
translated: Namo vajrakrodhāya.

original: tadya th'a / @122a * //
analyzed: tadya th'a / @122a * //
translated: Tadyathā.

original: aom hu lu hu lu /
analyzed: aom hu lu hu lu /
translated: Oṃ hulu hulu.🔽Tiṣṭha tiṣṭha.

original: tishtha tishtha / bandha bandha /
analyzed: tishtha tishtha / bandha bandha /
translated: Bandha bandha.

original: ha na ha na /
analyzed: ha na ha na /
translated: Hana hana.

original: aa mri te h'um phat /
analyzed: aa mri te h'um phat /
translated: Amṛte hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas lus la bgegs bsal ba'i phyir khu tshur gnyis nang du bcings te /
analyzed: de nas lus la bgegs bsal ba'i phyir khu tshur gnyis nang du bcings te /
translated: Then, in order to remove obstacles from the body, make two fists and cross them.

original: mdzub mo gnyis phyung nas bsgrengs nas mgo nas rkang ba la thug gi bar du brab par bya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis phyung nas bsgrengs nas mgo nas rkang ba la thug gi bar du brab par bya'o //
translated: Extend the two index fingers and tap from the head to the feet.

original: gsang sngags la /
analyzed: gsang sngags la /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom ha na ha na aa mri te h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ha na ha na aa mri te h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hana hana amṛte hūṃ phaṭ

original: de nas rdo rje'i go cha bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i go cha bya ste /
translated: Then, make the vajra armor.🔽From the extended añjali, cross the two little fingers and bend the two ring fingers and place them in between.

original: thal mo bkan pa las mthe'u chung gnyis bsnol ba'i bar du srin lag gnyis bkug ste bzhag / gung mo gnyis gshibs te bsgrengs la de'i tshigs gsum par mdzub mo bkug ste /
analyzed: thal mo bkan pa las mthe'u chung gnyis bsnol ba'i bar du srin lag gnyis bkug ste bzhag / gung mo gnyis gshibs te bsgrengs la de'i tshigs gsum par mdzub mo bkug ste /
translated: Extend the two middle fingers side by side, and at the third joint of those, bend the two index fingers.

original: mthe bong sbyar nas mthe bong gnyis dbus su gzhag go ;
analyzed: mthe bong sbyar nas mthe bong gnyis dbus su gzhag go ;
translated: Join the two thumbs and place them in the center.

original: / gsang sngags la /
analyzed: / gsang sngags la /
translated: The mantra is:

original: aom badzra aagni pra d'i pa t'a ye sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra aagni pra d'i pa t'a ye sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ vajra agni pradatāya svāhā

original: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis bskyed nas rdo rje'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis bskyed nas rdo rje'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very mudra, extend the two index fingers and make the shape of a vajra. This is the mudra of the vajra armor.

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
translated: Namo ratnatrayāya

original: aom h'um kha k'i li h'um phat /
analyzed: aom h'um kha k'i li h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hūṃ kha kha lī kha hūṃ phaṭ

original: de dag la sogs pa'am yang na sngags dang phyag rgya gzhan gyis kyang bdag nyid kyi mgo bo dang ; dpung mgo gnyis dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa rnams su go cha bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'am yang na sngags dang phyag rgya gzhan gyis kyang bdag nyid kyi mgo bo dang ; dpung mgo gnyis dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa rnams su go cha bya'o //
translated: Or else, with other mantras and gestures, one should don armor on one's head, two shoulders, heart, and throat.

original: de nas sngags dang phyag rgyas sa'am chu la gtugs te thams cad du bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags dang phyag rgyas sa'am chu la gtugs te thams cad du bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the mantra and gesture, one should touch the earth or water and wipe all around.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo dbus ma gnyis mthe bos mnan la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i sor mo dbus ma gnyis mthe bos mnan la /
translated: The two middle fingers of the left hand are pressed down with the thumb.

original: mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung gdu bu'i tshul du bya ste /

original: phyi'i gzugs kho na ltar snang bar zad kyi dngos po'i gzugs ni skra'i rtse mo stong gi cha tsam yang med do //
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs kho na ltar snang bar zad kyi dngos po'i gzugs ni skra'i rtse mo stong gi cha tsam yang med do //
translated: There is not even an iota of the form of an external thing.

original: de bas na 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes rnam par dbyad de /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa tsam mo zhes rnam par dbyad de /
translated: Therefore, one should analyze, “These three realms are only consciousness.”

original: mtha' dag nam mkha' lta bur bsams nas rang gi sems kyi rnam pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur blta ba 'di ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag nam mkha' lta bur bsams nas rang gi sems kyi rnam pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur blta ba 'di ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom ba yin no //
translated: Thinking that everything is like space, one should look at the aspect of one’s mind, which is like the orb of the moon. This is the cultivation of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mtshan 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'dren pa bde ba thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mtshan 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'dren pa bde ba thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This thought of awakening is the reason for the gnosis of omniscience, it attracts the roots of virtue, both mundane and supramundane, and it is the means for accomplishing all happiness.

original: de la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags rnams go rims bzhin du dgod pas de las 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'byung zhing rang gi lha nyid kyi gzugs kyis nam mkha'i dbyings mtha' dag khyab par byas te /
analyzed: de la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags rnams go rims bzhin du dgod pas de las 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'byung zhing rang gi lha nyid kyi gzugs kyis nam mkha'i dbyings mtha' dag khyab par byas te /
translated: In this regard, the mantras to be recited are set out in order, from which various light rays emanate, and one’s own deity’s form pervades the whole of space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i sprin chen po sbrul pas legs par mchod pa dang / sbrin chen po sbrul pa la bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun 'bab pas dmyal ba'i me rnams zhi zhi ba dang / sems dan dmyal ba'i sems can rnams tshim par byas nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs dang bcas pa'i 'od zer slar log nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i sprin chen po sbrul pas legs par mchod pa dang / sbrin chen po sbrul pa la bdud rtsi'i char gyi rgyun 'bab pas dmyal ba'i me rnams zhi zhi ba dang / sems dan dmyal ba'i sems can rnams tshim par byas nas yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gzugs dang bcas pa'i 'od zer slar log nas /
translated: Having made offerings to all the Tathagatas with the great cloud of offerings emanated by the bodhisattva, and having pacified the fires of the hells with the rain of nectar falling from the great cloud of offerings, and having satisfied the sentient beings of the hells, the light rays together with the forms of all the Tathagatas return

original: rang gi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: rang gi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: and enter into the moon mandala of one's mind.

original: bya ba'i rgyud las lha sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa ma bstan to snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud las lha sgrub pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rim pa ma bstan to snyam du bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not think that the stage of yoga for accomplishing the deity is not taught in the Action Tantras.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phal cher @125b ma bstan kyang phyag na rdo rjer dbang bskur ba dang / de kho na nyid bcu la 'jug pa dag las gtso bor bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phal cher @125b ma bstan kyang phyag na rdo rjer dbang bskur ba dang / de kho na nyid bcu la 'jug pa dag las gtso bor bstan to //
translated: Although it is not taught in most of the Action Tantras, it is taught in the Vajrapani Empowerment Tantra and in the Ten Principles.

original: gcig tu dngos grub thams cad ni gsang sngags kyi lha dang de kho na nyid la rag lus pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig tu dngos grub thams cad ni gsang sngags kyi lha dang de kho na nyid la rag lus pa yin la /
translated: In one way, all powers depend on the deity of the mantra and reality.

original: de dag rnam par nyams na zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de dag rnam par nyams na zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: If they are impaired, the rites of pacification, etc., will not be accomplished.

original: bla mas bshad pa dang rgyud kyi khyad par cung zad dpyad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bla mas bshad pa dang rgyud kyi khyad par cung zad dpyad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand them by investigating a little the explanations of the guru and the tantras.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis lha nyid kyi sku bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis lha nyid kyi sku bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should generate the body of the deity itself in stages.

original: de nas rang gi lha nyid kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang / mgrin pa dang / dpung mgo rnams su byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: de nas rang gi lha nyid kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang / mgrin pa dang / dpung mgo rnams su byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: Then, having formed the pledge seal of one's deity, one should consecrate the heart, the point between the eyebrows, the throat, and the shoulders.

original: de nas rin po che du ma las byas pa'i sa gzhi gser gyi bye ma gdal ba bsams nas gsang sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rin po che du ma las byas pa'i sa gzhi gser gyi bye ma gdal ba bsams nas gsang sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then, having imagined a ground made of many jewels with a spread of golden sand, one should consecrate it with this mantra:

original: aom tsa la b'i ra h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tsa la b'i ra h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ cala vajra svāhā.

original: de'i steng du 'o ma'i chus yongs su gang ba'i rgya mtsho chen po nya lcibs la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba padma dang ; autpal la sogs pa'i me tog gis rab tu brgyan pa rin po che'i bya'i tshogs mang po lding ba bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du 'o ma'i chus yongs su gang ba'i rgya mtsho chen po nya lcibs la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba padma dang ; autpal la sogs pa'i me tog gis rab tu brgyan pa rin po che'i bya'i tshogs mang po lding ba bsam par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, one should imagine a great ocean filled with milk, free of faults such as fish and eggs, adorned with flowers such as lotuses and utpalas, and with many flocks of jeweled birds flying around.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsang sngags ni bi ma la dha h'a h'um /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsang sngags ni bi ma la dha h'a h'um /
translated: The secret mantra of consecration is vimaladhā hūṃ.

original: de'i dbus su der ri rab ri'i rgyal po bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su der ri rab ri'i rgyal po bsam par bya ste /
translated: In the middle of that, one should imagine Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: gru bzhi pa ngos bzhi rin po che'i them skas kyi phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi pa ngos bzhi rin po che'i them skas kyi phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: It has four sides, adorned with a garland of jeweled staircases on the four sides.

original: them skas la la ni gser las byas pa /🔽la la ni dngul las byas pa /
analyzed: them skas la la ni gser las byas pa / la la ni dngul las byas pa /
translated: On some staircases, it is made of gold.🔽On some, it is made of silver.

original: la la ni aindra n'i la las byas pa /
analyzed: la la ni aindra n'i la las byas pa /
translated: On some, it is made of sapphire.

original: la la ni sbur long las byas pa /
analyzed: la la ni sbur long las byas pa /
translated: On some, it is made of agate.

original: mtha' ma thog thag dpag bsam gyi shing legs par bskrun pa rnam par rgyal ba'i bdan stong 'phur ba rang gi blo yi khyad par gyis brgyan pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma thog thag dpag bsam gyi shing legs par bskrun pa rnam par rgyal ba'i bdan stong 'phur ba rang gi blo yi khyad par gyis brgyan pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: Finally, imagine that the wish-fulfilling tree is well planted and that the banner of victory, which is decorated with special features of your own mind, is hoisted.

original: de nas de'i steng du padma'i sdong bu rin po che du mas brgyan pa'i rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'dab ma can /
analyzed: de nas de'i steng du padma'i sdong bu rin po che du mas brgyan pa'i rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'dab ma can /
translated: Then, on top of that, imagine a lotus stalk adorned with many jewels, with petals of various jewels,

original: gser gyi ze ba dang ldan pa sbur long gi ze 'bru can snying po'i thog la dngul gyi ri mos bskor ba /
analyzed: gser gyi ze ba dang ldan pa sbur long gi ze 'bru can snying po'i thog la dngul gyi ri mos bskor ba /
translated: with a golden pistil cup, and with a silver-colored anthers.

original: dpag tshad du ma'i khyon tsam ri rab kyi dbus brtol nas byung bar bsam mo //
analyzed: dpag tshad du ma'i khyon tsam ri rab kyi dbus brtol nas byung bar bsam mo //
translated: Imagine that it emerges from the center of Mount Meru, rising up to the height of many yojanas.

original: de las kyang padma'i dra ba gzhan brgya stong khri bye ba rnyed 'byung bar bsam mo //
analyzed: de las kyang padma'i dra ba gzhan brgya stong khri bye ba rnyed 'byung bar bsam mo //
translated: Also, imagine that from that lotus stalk, other lotus webs emerge in the hundreds of thousands.

original: de dag byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsang sngags 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag byin gyis brlabs pa'i gsang sngags 'di yin te /
translated: This is the secret mantra for blessing that:

original: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am /
analyzed: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga t'a n'am /
translated: namaḥ sarvatathāgatānāṃ

original: sarba th'a autga te spha ra na hi mam ga ga na kham sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sarba th'a autga te spha ra na hi mam ga ga na kham sv'ah'a /
translated: sarvakarma-avaraṇaviśodhani gaganakhāṃ svāhā.

original: de la phyag rgya ni phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo @126a * //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya ni phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo @126a * //
translated: The mudra is the añjali gesture of homage,

original: las phan tshun bsnol te g-yas pa'i mthe bos g-yon pa'i mthe bo mnan no //
analyzed: las phan tshun bsnol te g-yas pa'i mthe bos g-yon pa'i mthe bo mnan no //
translated: with the right hand crossed over the left and the right thumb pressing down on the left thumb.

original: phyag rgya 'di bcings nas gsang sngags lan brgya brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di bcings nas gsang sngags lan brgya brjod par bya'o //
translated: Forming this mudra, one should recite the mantra one hundred times.

original: des thams cad yang dag par gnas bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des thams cad yang dag par gnas bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, everything will be properly arranged.

original: der gzhung las byung ba'i rim pas bla re dag kyang yid kyis skad cig la bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: der gzhung las byung ba'i rim pas bla re dag kyang yid kyis skad cig la bsam par bya'o //
translated: There, according to the sequence in the treatise, one should mentally imagine the canopies in an instant.

original: de'i phyir de la spros pa dang ldan pa'i gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la spros pa dang ldan pa'i gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not be afraid of the extensive treatise with its elaborations.

original: de nas lha spyan drang ste /
analyzed: de nas lha spyan drang ste /
translated: Then, one should invite the deities.

original: 'di ni spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for inviting them.

original: gser dang dngul dang zangs ma dang rdo ba dag dang shing gi'am zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang zangs ma dang rdo ba dag dang shing gi'am zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Whether made of gold, silver, copper, stone, or wood, or🔽For pacifying, increasing, and fierce activities,

original: zhi dang rgyas dang drag sbyod dang // rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
analyzed: zhi dang rgyas dang drag sbyod dang // rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
translated: for the highest, middling, and lowest

original: las dang dngos grub rnams la ni //
analyzed: las dang dngos grub rnams la ni //
translated: karmas and siddhis,

original: rim pa'i snod rnams sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: rim pa'i snod rnams sbyar bar bya //
translated: the vessels should be applied in sequence.

original: kha dog yon tan bshad pa las //
analyzed: kha dog yon tan bshad pa las //
translated: The colors and qualities of the vessels🔽are explained in the Tantra of the Emergence of Cakrasaṃvara

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang ci rigs pa'i //🔽snod rnams ji ltar 'dod par ni //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang ci rigs pa'i // snod rnams ji ltar 'dod par ni //
translated: and elsewhere, as appropriate.🔽The vessels are to be used

original: mchod yon phyir yang sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: mchod yon phyir yang sbyar bar bya //
translated: as desired for the purpose of offering water for drinking.

original: mchod yon phyir ni zangs kyi snod //
analyzed: mchod yon phyir ni zangs kyi snod //
translated: For the purpose of offering water for drinking,

original: las rnams kun la rab tu shis //
analyzed: las rnams kun la rab tu shis //
translated: a copper vessel is suitable for all activities.

original: de dag las rigs dang las dang dngos grub dag la gang 'dod pa'i snod blangs te /
analyzed: de dag las rigs dang las dang dngos grub dag la gang 'dod pa'i snod blangs te /
translated: Having taken up the vessel that is appropriate for the family, activity, and spiritual power that one desires from among those,🔽then, with a pure flower

original: de nas rjes su me tog dang // spos kyi chu ni gtsang ba yis //
analyzed: de nas rjes su me tog dang // spos kyi chu ni gtsang ba yis //
translated: and fragrant water,

original: mchod yon cho ga bzhin bshams la //
analyzed: mchod yon cho ga bzhin bshams la //
translated: one should set out the offering in accordance with the rite🔽and fumigate it with incense.

original: bdug spos kyis ni rab tu bdug / de la zhi ba dang dngos grub rab gnyis la ni nas dang 'o ma'i mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdug spos kyis ni rab tu bdug / de la zhi ba dang dngos grub rab gnyis la ni nas dang 'o ma'i mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: For pacifying and the highest spiritual powers, one should offer water for drinking with rice and milk.

original: rgyas pa dang dngos grub 'bring la ni til dang zho dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa dang dngos grub 'bring la ni til dang zho dbul bar bya'o //
translated: For increasing and middling spiritual powers, one should offer sesame seeds and yogurt.

original: drag shul spyod pa dang dngos grub tha ma la ni ba'i gcin 'bras ko tra ba dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: drag shul spyod pa dang dngos grub tha ma la ni ba'i gcin 'bras ko tra ba dang bcas pa'am /
translated: For wrathful activity and the lowest spiritual powers, one should offer cow’s urine with kutaja flowers,

original: yang na khrag dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na khrag dbul bar bya'o //
translated: or else blood.

original: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
analyzed: rab dang 'bring dang tha ma yi //
translated: The results of all actions,

original: las rnams kun la 'bras yos shis //
analyzed: las rnams kun la 'bras yos shis //
translated: whether superior, middling, or inferior, are certain.

original: sbos dang me tog ku sha til //
analyzed: sbos dang me tog ku sha til //
translated: Rice, flowers, kuśa grass, and sesame

original: chu rnams bye brag med par bzang //
analyzed: chu rnams bye brag med par bzang //
translated: are good, without distinction, for the water.

original: 'di ma 'byor gyis bdag la ni //
analyzed: 'di ma 'byor gyis bdag la ni //
translated: If these are not available,

original: bzod pa ci 'byor pas kyang bya //
analyzed: bzod pa ci 'byor pas kyang bya //
translated: one should do it with whatever is available.

original: de nas gsang sngags kyi lha spyan drangs pa'i phyir mchod yon bshams nas rang gi rigs kyi rig pa'i rgyal po'am /
analyzed: de nas gsang sngags kyi lha spyan drangs pa'i phyir mchod yon bshams nas rang gi rigs kyi rig pa'i rgyal po'am /
translated: Then, in order to invite the mantra deities, having arranged the welcoming drink, one should recite the king of awareness mantras of one's own family,

original: yang na spyi yi rigs kyi snying po'am //
analyzed: yang na spyi yi rigs kyi snying po'am //
translated: or the essence mantra of the general family,

original: de spyan drang ba'i gsang sngags sam //
analyzed: de spyan drang ba'i gsang sngags sam //
translated: or the secret mantra for inviting them,

original: so so'i las thams cad pas yongs su bzlas so //
analyzed: so so'i las thams cad pas yongs su bzlas so //
translated: or the one for all activities.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal po dang / rig sngags rang bzlas so //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal po dang / rig sngags rang bzlas so //
translated: One should recite the king of awareness mantras and the awareness mantra oneself.

original: de ltar yongs su bzlas nas gsang sngags kyi gnas kyi phyogs gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bzlas nas gsang sngags kyi gnas kyi phyogs gang yin pa'am /
translated: Having recited in this way, one should look in the direction of the mantra abode,

original: ri mo la @126b sogs pa la lha'i gzugs bzhag pa der bltas te /
analyzed: ri mo la @126b sogs pa la lha'i gzugs bzhag pa der bltas te /
translated: or where the deity's form is placed, such as in a painting.

original: 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'di skad ces /
translated: One should say this:

original: dad pa dang ni dam tshig gis //
analyzed: dad pa dang ni dam tshig gis //
translated: By faith and samaya,

original: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs bcom ldan 'dir //🔽bdag gi mchod yon 'di bzhes nas //
analyzed: tshur gshegs tshur gshegs bcom ldan 'dir // bdag gi mchod yon 'di bzhes nas //
translated: Come, come, O Blessed One,🔽accept this water for the feet

original: mchod pas bdag la dgyes par mdzod //🔽ces bya ste /
analyzed: mchod pas bdag la dgyes par mdzod // ces bya ste /
translated: and be pleased with me through this worship.

original: de nas bus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te /🔽gsang sngags mchog rnams mgo bo'i thad ka nas mchod yon dbul lo //🔽'bring rnams la brang nas so //
analyzed: de nas bus mo gnyis sa la btsugs te / gsang sngags mchog rnams mgo bo'i thad ka nas mchod yon dbul lo // 'bring rnams la brang nas so //
translated: Then, having placed the two knees on the ground,🔽one should offer the water for the feet with the supreme mantras at the level of the head.🔽With the middling mantras, at the level of the chest.

original: phal pa rnams la ni lte ba'i thad ka nas mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: phal pa rnams la ni lte ba'i thad ka nas mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With the ordinary mantras, at the level of the navel.

original: yang na yid gtso bor gyur pa yin pas bzhi po gang yang rung bas spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yid gtso bor gyur pa yin pas bzhi po gang yang rung bas spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, since the mind is the principal [factor], one should invite [the deity] with any of the four [methods].🔽One should join the palms together,

original: thal mo sbyar ba'am /🔽mchod yon nam /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba'am / mchod yon nam /
translated: or take up the water for the feet,

original: me tog blang ba'am /
analyzed: me tog blang ba'am /
translated: or take up flowers,

original: yang na thal mo sbyar ba bya ste /🔽tshur gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyis spyan drangs nas las kyi bye brag las shar ram /🔽byang ngam / lho'am /
analyzed: yang na thal mo sbyar ba bya ste / tshur gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid kyis spyan drangs nas las kyi bye brag las shar ram / byang ngam / lho'am /
translated: or join the palms together.

original: nub tu kha bltas te lha mdun du bzhugs su gsol /
analyzed: nub tu kha bltas te lha mdun du bzhugs su gsol /
translated: Having invited [the deity] with Come, come and so forth, one should request the deity to sit in front, facing east, north, west, or south, according to the particular rite.

original: rgyas par ni rgyud las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rgyud las shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive [rite] should be known from the Tantra.

original: slar gshegs su gsol ba ni spyan drangs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya ba las gsang sngags dang phyag rgyar ldan pas bye brag tu bzhud cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: slar gshegs su gsol ba ni spyan drangs pa'i cho ga bzhin du bya ba las gsang sngags dang phyag rgyar ldan pas bye brag tu bzhud cig ces bya'o //
translated: The request for departure is done according to the rite of invocation, except that one should say, “Please depart” in combination with the mantra and the mudrā.

original: de la 'di ni phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni phyag rgya yin te /
translated: The mudrā for that is as follows:

original: sor mo phan tshun gyi bar du bsnol nas thal mo bkan la mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng ngo //
analyzed: sor mo phan tshun gyi bar du bsnol nas thal mo bkan la mdzub mo gnyis gshibs te bsgreng ngo //
translated: Interlace the fingers, extend the two index fingers, and erect them side by side.

original: mthe bong gnyis g-yab pa ni spyan drangs pa'o //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis g-yab pa ni spyan drangs pa'o //
translated: Waving the two thumbs is the invocation.

original: phyir bsgyel ba ni slar gshegs su gsol ba'o //
analyzed: phyir bsgyel ba ni slar gshegs su gsol ba'o //
translated: Inversion is the request for departure.

original: spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: spyan drang ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of invocation.

original: de ltar lha rnams spyan drangs te /
